title: Electric Light Bulb

adjectives: Of, relating to, produced by, operated with, or utilising electricity; electrical.
Using or providing or producing or transmitting or operated by electricity
Emitting or reflecting light readily or in large amounts
verbs: To give off light from heat or to emit light as if heated.
Emit light; be bright, as of the sun or a light
To emit beams of light; shine; radiate.
nouns: An evacuated glass bulb containing a metal filament which is heated by electrical resistance to produce light.
A filament surrounded by glass which is screwed into the socket of a lamp and which emits light when supplied with current.
Also known as an incandescent lamp
Evacuated glass bulb containing a metal filament that produces light.
Artificial light source powered by electricity.
A light bulb whose metallic filament is heated by an electric current.

An incandescent light bulb, incandescent lamp or incandescent light globe is an electric light which produces light with a wire filament heated to a high temperature by an electric current passing through it, until it glows.
Device that produces light from electricity
Electric lamp consisting of a transparent or translucent glass housing containing a wire filament (usually tungsten) that emits light when heated by electricity
An electric light is a device that produces light by the flow of electric current.
An idea is a concept or mental impression.
The content of cognition; the main thing you are thinking about
In philosophy, ideas are usually construed as mental representational images of some object.
A plan or notion that is formed and exists in the mind as a result of mental activity.
More generally, any result of mental activity; a thought, a notion; a way of thinking.
Mental image or concept
Electromagnetic radiation of moderate wavelengths
Electromagnetic radiation that is capable of causing a visual sensation.

Light is electromagnetic radiation with a wavelength that is visible to the eye or, in a technical or scientific context, the word is sometimes used to mean electromagnetic radiation of all wavelengths.
Object, natural or artificial, that produces light.
(physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation
A property in graphic design software that makes objects visible, much like light in the natural world.
Light is radiant energy, usually referring to electromagnetic radiation that is visible to the human eye, and is responsible for the sense of sight.
In chemistry shorthand
A general term used for all phenomena caused by electric charge whether static or in motion.
Electricity is a general term encompassing a variety of phenomena resulting from the presence and flow of electric charge.
Electricity is the set of physical phenomena associated with the presence and flow of electric charge.
A physical phenomenon associated with stationary or moving electrons and protons
Physical phenomena associated with the presence and flow of electric charge
